books.title: Candida
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: A clergyman’s beliefs about his respectable household are challenged by a young poet who is in love with his wife.

books.title: The Secret of the Caves
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Four boys vacation at nearby caves only to be swept up in a mystery.

books.title: The Autobiography of an Idea
books.author: Louis H. Sullivan
books.summary: Famed architect Louis H. Sullivan recounts his life and career.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: Mr. Mulliner Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the eccentric (and hilarious) Mr. Mulliner, who regales the patrons of the Anglers’ Rest with tales of his colorful and amusing relatives.

books.title: Heartbreak House
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Men and women of the English leisured classes gather at a country house on the eve of war to discuss love, life, and the future.

books.title: Khaled
books.author: F. Marion Crawford
books.summary: A powerful genie is condemned to live the life of a man, unless he can find true love.

books.title: Howards End
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: The lives of three families of different classes intertwine in Edwardian England.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: Tracks in the Snow
books.author: Godfrey R. Benson
books.summary: A rector investigates the mystery behind a strange letter that may be connected to his friend’s murder.

books.title: Bashan and I
books.author: Thomas Mann
books.summary: A renowned novelist describes the unique relation that links him to his dog.

books.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
books.author: David Hume
books.summary: Hume examines the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality and human understanding.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: The Coming of Bill
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A domineering author of books on eugenics and hygiene makes a match between her niece and an idle artist, intending them to raise a son according to her principles, regardless of the consequences.

books.title: Search the Sky
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man visits several worlds as he attempts to discover why humanity is dying out.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A collection of all of the short stories and novellas written by Leo Tolstoy.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
